name: Primary Data Producer: Name
help: Often this is the Principle Investigator, Project Scientist, or Project Manager
question: Who is the primary person responsible for the collection or creation of this data product?
comments:
The form will need a way to let the user who is logged into EDPub and completing the form indicate if they are this role or not.
If  "same as" the logged in user, Autopopulate from EDLogin User Login, if "same as" the logged in user

name: Primary Data Producer: Organization
help: n/a
question: n/a

name: Primary Data Producer: Email
help: n/a
question: n/a

name: Primary Data Producer: ORCID
help: An Open Researcher and Contributor Identifier (ORCID) provides a persistent digital identifier to distinguish researchers and properly attribute their research outputs. For more information, see the ORCID web site (https://support.orcid.org).
question: n/a
comments: A "nice to have" would be to validate that it's a valid ORCID

name: Publication Point of Contact: Name
help: The publication process includes ingesting, archiving, quality checking, documenting, and making the data product publicly accessible.
question: During the publication process, who should the DAAC contact with questions regarding this data product?
comments:
The form will need a way to let the user who is logged into EDPub and completing the form indicate if they are this role or not. 

If "same as" the logged in user, autopopulate from EDLogin User Login, 
OR  if "same as" Primary Data Producer,  autopopulate from Primary Data Producer values

name: Publication Point of Contact: Organization
help: n/a
question: n/a

name: Publication Point of Contact: Email
help: n/a
question: n/a

name: Publication Point of Contact: ORCID
help: An Open Researcher and Contributor Identifier (ORCID) provides a persistent digital identifier to distinguish researchers and properly attribute their research outputs. For more information, see the ORCID web site (https://support.orcid.org).
question: n/a
comments: A "nice to have" would be to validate that it's a valid ORCID

name: Long-term Support Point of Contact: Name
help: DAACs may need assistance in answering questions from data product users. For example, questions related to data algorithm and processing approaches, calibration/validation assessments, or instrumentation.
question: Once this data product is publicly accessible, who should the DAAC contact with questions regarding this data product?
comments:
The form will need a way to let the user who is logged into EDPub and completing the form indicate if they are this role or not. 

If "same as" the logged in user, autopopulate from EDLogin User Login, 
OR  if "same as" Primary Data Producer,  autopopulate from Primary Data Producer values
OR if "same as" Publication Point of Contact, autopopulate from Publication Point of Contact values

name: Long-term Support Point of Contact: Organization
help: n/a
question: n/a

name: Long-term Support Point of Contact: Email
help: n/a
question: n/a

name: Long-term Support Point of Contact: ORCID
help: An Open Researcher and Contributor Identifier (ORCID) provides a persistent digital identifier to distinguish researchers and properly attribute their research outputs. For more information, see the ORCID web site (https://support.orcid.org).
question: n/a
comments: A "nice to have" would be to validate that it's a valid ORCID

validation: No NULL within First, Last name pair
name: Data Product Citation: List of data producers
help:
The DAAC will use this information to construct a data product citation, which is a reference to data for the purpose of credit attribution and facilitation of data access.

For example:
NASA OBPG. 2020. MODIS Aqua Level 3 SST Thermal IR 8 Day 9km Daytime V2019.0. Ver. 2019.0. PO.DAAC, CA, USA. https://doi.org/10.5067/MODSA-8D9D9

CARVE Science Team . 2017. CARVE: In-flight Photos from the CARVE Aircraft, Alaska, 2013-2015. ORNL DAAC, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, USA. https://doi.org/10.3334/ORNLDAAC/1435

McGill, Matthew , Dennis L Hlavka, John E. Yorks and Patrick A. Selmer. 2019. GOES-R PLT Cloud Physics LiDAR (CPL). Dataset available online from the NASA Global Hydrology Resource Center DAAC, Huntsville, Alabama, U.S.A. DOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.5067/GOESRPLT/CPL/DATA101
question: Please list the people or groups that were involved in the creation of this data product in the order that they should be credited in the data product citation.
comments: What to store names (First, Last( and groups as individual elements rather than a string of text.
type:
Free text fields for Add Individual (First Name, Last Name) or Add Group (Group Name);  
Ability to add multiple records; Preserve the order

validation: No NULL for University or Other free text
name: Funding source: Organization(s)
help: n/a
source: NASA, NOAA, NSF, USGS, University <free text>, Other <free text>
question: What organization(s) funded the creation of this data product?

name: Funding source: Program/Program Element
help: For example, NASA programs such as MEaSUREs, Terrestrial Hydrology, Earth Venture, ACCESS, or AIST.
question: Under what program or program element within the funding organization was this data product created?

name: Funding source: Grant Number
help: For example, NNX08AZ90A.
question: If available, please provide the grant number for the funding that supported the creation of this data product.

name: Data product name
help: The DAAC will use this information to develop an official data product name in compliance with DAAC/ESDIS standards.
question: How do you refer to this data product?
comments: Tech Writer review up to this point.

name: n/a
help: n/a
question: Are data within this data product observational and/or model output?
comments:
If Model, then show Model Name and Input Data.
If Observation, then show Platform Name, Instrument Name, Instrument Description, Input Data
If BOTH, then show Platform Name, Instrument Name, Instrument Description, Model Name, Input Data

name: Platform and Instrument
help: Please be as specific as possible when including the platforms and instruments. For example, include tail numbers for aircraft or uniquely identify instruments when multiple instances exist on the same platform.
question: What platform(s) and instrument(s) were used to collect the data within this data product?
type: Free text "platform - instrument" pairs; allow multiple pairs to be entered

name: (if model or both) Model
help: n/a
question: What is the name and version of the model used to produce this data product?

validation: No NULL for free text if Other picked
name: Data Processing Level
help: For descriptions of the processing levels, please refer to NASA Processing Level page (https://science.nasa.gov/earth-science/earth-science-data/data-processing-levels-for-eosdis-data-products).
source: Level 0, Level 1A, Level 1B, Level 2, Level 3, Level 4, Other (free text)
question: What is the processing level of this data product?

name: Data Product Temporal Coverage: Beginning date/time
Data Product Temporal Coverage: End date/time
Data format
help:
For a list of NASA approved data formats, please refer to the NASA Earthdata Standards and Practicies web page (https://earthdata.nasa.gov/esdis/eso/standards-and-references#data-formats).

Providing code to read non-standard data formats will assist the DAAC in understanding the structure and content of this data product.
source: NASA approved data formats (ASCII, GeoTIFF, HDF 5, HDF-EOS 5, OGC KML, NetCDF-4, NetCDF Classic)
question:
What is the format(s) of the files within this data product?

If selecting "Other", please upload code to read the data or provide a URL to code to read the data.
type:
Controlled: Multiple choice with "Other" and text box

File upload widget for multiple files AND Free text

validation: Free text validated as number; dropdown value must be selected
name: Data product volume
help: The DAAC uses the total volume of the final data product to plan data storage requirements. If the final data product is not complete, please provide your best estimate.
source: dropdown with units (KB, MB, GB, TB, PB)
question: What is the estimated or actual total volume of this data product?
type: Free text (number, allow decimal); Controlled: dropdown

name: Number of files
help: If the final data product is not complete, please provide your best estimate.
question: What is the estimated or actual total number of files in this data product?

name: Data product status
help: n/a
source:
YES|NO
If YES, Dropdown: daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, yearly, ad-hoc
question:
Once this data product is publicly accessible, will you continue to create data to extend this data product? 
If "Yes", what is the anticipated frequency of additional data deliveries to the DAAC?

name: Data product restrictions
help:
Link to NASA Open Data Policy
https://earthdata.nasa.gov/collaborate/open-data-services-and-software/data-information-policy
question:
Can this data product be publicly released in compliance with NASA's Open Data Policy?
If "No", please provide a brief explanation.
comments: I think this should be both Archival and Questionnaire, since the CMR requires an Abstract for the UMM-C
type:
Controlled: Yes/No
If NO, then free text

name: Publication(s) describing this data product
help: For example, a overview paper describing the research, methods, or initial results related to this data product.
question: Please provide the citation or Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for any publications describing this data product.

name: Data product DOI
help: This would be a DOI for the actual data product and not for a publication related to this data product.
question: If a Digitial Object Identifer (DOI) already exists for this data product, please provide it.

validation: Validate that file is uploaded OR text field populated; validate file(s) against file size limit
name: Sample data file(s)
help: Providing data files that are representative of the range of data within this data product will help the DAAC to better understand the data format, structure, and content.
question: Please upload a sample data file(s) or provide a URL to a location where a sample data file(s) can be accessed.
comments: Will need to show the user what the upload limites are
type: File upload widget for multiple files AND Free text
